org.ros.actionlib.client
Class ActionClient<T_ACTION_FEEDBACK extends Message,T_ACTION_GOAL extends Message,T_ACTION_RESULT extends Message,T_FEEDBACK extends Message,T_GOAL extends Message,T_RESULT extends Message>

java.lang.Object
  org.ros.actionlib.client.ActionClient<T_ACTION_FEEDBACK,T_ACTION_GOAL,T_ACTION_RESULT,T_FEEDBACK,T_GOAL,T_RESULT>
Type Parameters:
T_ACTION_FEEDBACK - action feedback message
T_ACTION_GOAL - action goal message
T_ACTION_RESULT - action result message
T_FEEDBACK - feedback message
T_GOAL - goal message
T_RESULT - result message
Direct Known Subclasses:
FibonacciActionClient
public class ActionClient<T_ACTION_FEEDBACK extends Message,T_ACTION_GOAL extends Message,T_ACTION_RESULT extends Message,T_FEEDBACK extends Message,T_GOAL extends Message,T_RESULT extends Message>
extends java.lang.Object

An ActionClient is the client interface of the actionlib package. It provides means to interact with an action server, i.e. sending goal messages to the action server, which tries to compute/create a result according to the request that is sent back to the client. During the process of getting the final result an action server may send feedback messages in order to update the action client on the current state of its request. A request may be canceled by the ActionClient by sending a cancel message to the server.
Every goal that is sent to the server is represented by a ClientGoalHandle that allows to monitor the goal's progress. An ActionClient may send more than one goal message at a time.

See Also:
SimpleActionClient

Constructor Detail

ActionClient

public ActionClient(java.lang.String name,
                    ActionSpec<?,T_ACTION_FEEDBACK,T_ACTION_GOAL,T_ACTION_RESULT,T_FEEDBACK,T_GOAL,T_RESULT> spec)
             throws RosException
Constructor used to create an ActionClient that will be a child node of the node represented by the given node handle. It communicates in a given nodeName space on a given action specification.

Parameters:
nameSpace - The nodeName space to communicate within (specified by the action server)
spec - The specification of the action the ActionClient shall use
Throws:
RosException - If setting up the needed subscribers and publishers fail
Method Detail

Add all action client publishers and subscribers to the given node.

Lifetime of the node is taken over by the client.

public void waitForActionServerToStart()

Throws:
java.lang.InterruptedException

waitForActionServerToStart

public boolean waitForActionServerToStart(long timeout,
                                          java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit units)
                                   throws java.lang.InterruptedException
Waits up to the specified duration for the action server to start up. If no connection could be established within the given time, the method returns indicating the error.

Parameters:
timeout - The maximum duration to wait for the action server to start up. A zero length duration results in unlimited waiting.
units - The units for timeout
Returns:
true - if the ActionClient could establish a connection to the action server within the given time
false - otherwise
Throws:
java.lang.InterruptedException

publishCancelGoal

protected void publishCancelGoal(org.ros.message.actionlib_msgs.GoalID cancelMessage)
Publishes the given GoalID message on the cancel topic. This should cause the action server to stop working on the goal represented by this GoalID.

Parameters:
cancelMessage - The GoalID message using the id of the goal that shall be canceled

doStatusCallback

protected void doStatusCallback(org.ros.message.actionlib_msgs.GoalStatusArray goalStatuses)
Callback method used when the subscriber of the action server's status topic receives a new list of GoalStatus messages. This ActionClient's GoalManager gets informed about the newly arrived messages.

Parameters:
goalStatuses - A list of GoalStatus messages
See Also:
GoalManager.updateStatuses(GoalStatusArray)

Parameters:
actionFeedback - An action feedback message
